name: places/ChIJnZ1jAsNZwokRv0h8Lbp6tzY
formattedAddress: 400 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 400 Grand St, New York, NY 10002-3949, USA

editorialSummary.text: Retail chain offering home goods, clothing, electronics & more, plus exclusive designer collections.

originalText.text:
This Target is horrible. The employees are constantly just fooling around with each other and god forbid you ask them a question. Inventory carts are always blocking a lot of aisles while the employees are always grouped up in different parts of the store talking. I asked an employee for help during self checkout when I didn‚Äôt see a discount applied on an item that very clearly said it was 20% off for Target Circle members and the dates of the promotion were 1/14-1/20. First problem is when I started explaining the issue, she was off looking at her friend in the distance and laughing with her saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm helping a customer‚Äù and then turned back to me and said ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù so I had to repeat myself. She scanned the item and said no discount was showing up. I told her there‚Äôs a sign there that says there‚Äôs a discount and I could show her the sign. She just laughed at me and fiddled with her scan thing and just said ‚ÄúWhat do you want me to do, change the price?‚Äù while laughing again. She was of no help, she wouldn‚Äôt even try to help me fix this issue, I offered to show her the sign so she could tell me if I was missing something but god forbid I ask her to do her job. All she was worried about was going back to her friend to talk.

The manager at this place really needs to reevaluate their employees and actually hire people who will work and not just hang out with their friends.

originalText.text: Excellent experience! Went in for one item and I noticed a big sale going on, with sheets, blankets, bedding covers, pillowcases, I took advantage... It was amazing! üòÑ

text.text: Excellent experience! Went in for one item and I noticed a big sale going on, with sheets, blankets, bedding covers, pillowcases, I took advantage... It was amazing! üòÑ

originalText.text: It's a relatively small target non the less they have a little bit of everything. I was dying for this store to open for the longest cause it's just couple of blocks away from my apartment (convince to the maximum). LES definitely needed this spot for a quick grocery shopping. The workers were extremely friendly and helpful. Ignore the reviews that are bad mouthing the employees here (they probably think that the world revolves around them). This place has restrooms and water fountain. I totally like the inside design, definitely a LES vibe. Since the store just opened it is extremely crowded. To avoid lines for checking out get there early morning or late evening. I'm sure the hype will die off soon in a month or two.

originalText.text: This newer Target is just over the bridge for me. If I want to, I can take a good walk there. Yet I was very disappointed in this Target location. I mean we all know how large they are but not this location. Like always, anywhere in New York City/Manhattan area, parking is always a challenge to being with. For me, it's only worth coming here for emergency needs but I don't believe I'll do much shopping here.

originalText.text: A relatively new, but scaled down Target on the LES. You can find a nice selection of items but it pales in comparison to the full-sized stores. The lines (which are all self checkout) can't get long at times.
